title: MS AccessRight()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessRight()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Extract 4 characters from a string (starting from right):
SELECT 
  Right("SQL Tutorial is cool", 4) AS ExtractString;

Definition and Usage
The Right() function extracts a number of characters from a string (starting from 
right).
Note:
See also the
Left()
function.
Syntax
Right(
string
,
number_of_chars
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string
Required. The string to extract from
number_of_chars
Required. The number of characters to extract. If this parameter is 
    higher than the number of characters in
string
, 
  this function will return the entire
string
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000
More Examples
Example
Extract 5 characters from the text in the "CustomerName" column (starting from right):
SELECT Right(CustomerName, 5) AS ExtractString
FROM Customers;

❯
★
+1

quiz.question: What is SQL Tutorial?
options:
higher than the number of characters in
string
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of SQL Tutorial is 'cool"'.

quiz.question: What is If this parameter?
options:
higher than the number of characters in
string
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of If this parameter is 'higher than the number of characters in
string'.

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessRight()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessRight()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessRight()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
